input:
## Clinical Case: Case number 10128

### Clinical History
A 43-year-old gentleman presented with neurological symptoms and CT of the head was abnormal with signs of hydrocephalus. Endoscopic third ventriculostomy relieved the pressure symptoms of hydrocephalus and biopsy confirmed the diagnosis. Further neurosurgery was not possible and the patient underwent radical radiotherapy with good response.


### Question
Based on the clinical history and imaging findings above, what is the most likely diagnosis?

### Options
A. Meningioma
B. Dermoid
C. Tectal Glioma
D. Intracranial Germ cell tumour
E. Pineoblastoma

Please analyze this case and select the correct answer (A, B, C, D, or E).
Use the research_tools.py script to plan your research, query the database, and submit your answer.

args.command: uv run python src/agent_v2/skills/med-deepresearch/scripts/research_tools.py plan --steps "Analyze patient demographics and symptoms" "Research hydrocephalus causes in adults" "Investigate endoscopic third ventriculostomy indications" "Research biopsy-confirmed diagnoses with good radiotherapy response" "Compare differential diagnoses" --goal "Identify the most likely diagnosis based on clinical presentation and treatment response"

This matches the clinical history exactly."
